result.execSummary:
The defendant Sheila J. Quirk was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Conceal (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant to pay fine, costs and DNA surcharge within 60 days (5/8/15) or request a payment plan through the Dodge County Clerk of Courts office within said time.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sheila J. Quirk

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Sheila J. Quirk in court with attorney Paul R Uttech.  Robert Barrington appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Def. will plead today; Court reviews recomm.; Court reviews GPQPA & WOR; Court reviews charge/penalties; Def. pleads NC to Retail Theft; parties stip. to facts; victim rights complied with; Court finds plea made FVK&I and finds Def. guilty of Retail Theft; State head; Atty. Uttech heard; Def. makes statement; Court imposes sentence

* $100 F+C = $389.00 within 60 days
* $200 DNA surcharge within 60 days

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with Kohls Dept Store, Beaver Dam WI.   Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.

9:07 - Defendant Sheila J. Quirk in court with attorney Paul R Uttech.  Robert G. Barrington appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Atty Uttech enters Not Guilty plea. Court finds probable cause. RD & JT set. Court sets $500 PA bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not go on the premises at Kohls Dept Store, Beaver Dam WI.  Return date scheduled for March 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
